API¶

Module lib¶

Module adapter¶

Class DatabaseAdapter¶

class pyramid_oereb.lib.adapter.DatabaseAdapter[source]¶
add_connection(connection_string)[source]¶

Adds a new connection to this object. Also creates the necessary engine and session object.

Parameters:connection_string (str) – The rfc1738 URL string which defines the database connection
get_connections()[source]¶

Returns a dictionary with the available connections.

Returns:The available connections.
Return type:dict
get_session(key, request=None)[source]¶

The point where you will get what you need: The session to talk to the database!

Parameters:
  • key (str) – The key to identify the desired connection in the pool of available connections.
  • request (pyramid.request.Request or None) – The request of the underlying pyramid application. This can be useful to handle errorcases and treat sessions in the right way.
Returns:

The requested clean session instance ready for use
Return type:

sqlalchemy.orm.Session
Raises:

KeyError

Class FileAdapter¶

class pyramid_oereb.lib.adapter.FileAdapter(cwd=None)[source]¶

Module config¶

pyramid_oereb.lib.config.parse(cfg_file, cfg_section)[source]¶

Parses the defined YAML file and returns the defined section as dictionary.

Parameters:
  • cfg_file (str) – The YAML file to be parsed.
  • cfg_section (str) – The section to be returned.
Returns:

The parsed section as dictionary.
Return type:

dict

Class Config¶

class pyramid_oereb.lib.config.Config[source]¶
static get(key, default=None)[source]¶

Returns the specified configuration value.

Parameters:
  • key (str) – Configuration parameter name.
  • default – Default value if the specified parameter is not defined. Defaults to None.
Returns:

The specified configuration or default value
Return type:
static get_address_config()[source]¶

Returns a dictionary of the configured address settings.

Returns:The configured address settings.
Return type:dict
static get_all_federal()[source]¶

Returns a list of all federal topic codes.

Returns:All federal topic codes.
Return type:list of str

Returns the multilingual base data description with updated currentness.

Parameters:datetime.datetime (base_data_date) – The base data currentness.
Returns:The multilingual base data with updated currentness.
Return type:dict

Returns:The configured exclusion_of_liability settings.
Return type:dict
static get_extract_config()[source]¶

Returns a dictionary of the configured extract settings.

Returns:The configured extract settings.
Return type:dict

Return type:list
static get_glossary_config()[source]¶

Returns:The configured glossary settings.
Return type:dict
static get_language()[source]¶

Returns a list of available languages.

Returns:The available languages.
Return type:list
static get_law_status(theme_code, law_status_config, law_status_code)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • theme_code (str) – The theme code.
  • law_status_config (dict) – The configured mapping of the plrs law status.
  • law_status_code (str) – The law status code read from the data to wrap it into the only two allowed values: “inForce” or “runningModifications” which are possible on the extract.
Returns:

The mapped law status. This is “inForce” or “runningModifications”.
Return type:

str
Raises:

AttributeError – If the passed law status code does not match one of the configured ones.
static get_law_status_translations(code)[source]¶

Obtaining the law status translations from config via the code.

Parameters:code (str) – The law status code. This must be “inForce” or “runningModifications”. Any other value won’t match and throw a silent error.
Returns:The translation from the configuration.
Return type:dict
static get_logo_config()[source]¶

Returns a dictionary of the configured file path’s to the logos.

Returns:The configured paths to the logos wrapped in a dictionary.
Return type:dict
static get_municipality_config()[source]¶

Returns a dictionary of the configured municipality settings.

Returns:The configured municipality settings.
Return type:dict
static get_object_path(path, default=None, required=None)[source]¶

Returns the configuration object at a specified path.

example: get_object_path(‘app.print’, {‘dpi’: 300}, [‘map_size’])

Parameters:
  • path (str) – Dot separated path of the wonted object.
  • default (dict) – Default dictionary values of the object. Defaults to {}.
  • required (list) – The list of required sub values in the object. Defaults to [].
Returns:

The specified configuration object.
Return type:
static get_oereblex_config()[source]¶

Returns a dictionary of the configured OEREBlex settings.

Returns:The configured OEREBlex settings.
Return type:dict
static get_plr_cadastre_authority()[source]¶

Returns an office record for the configured PLR cadastre authority.

Returns:The configured PLR cadastre authority.
Return type:pyramid_oereb.lib.records.office.OfficeRecord

Return type:dict

static init(configfile, configsection)[source]¶

Loads configuration from yaml file and provides methods for generating webservice output.

Parameters:
  • config_file (str) – The configuration yaml file.
  • config_section (str) – The section within the yaml file.

Module processor¶

Class Processor¶

class pyramid_oereb.lib.processor.Processor(real_estate_reader, municipality_reader, exclusion_of_liability_reader, glossary_reader, plr_sources, extract_reader)[source]¶
exclusion_of_liability_reader¶

**Returns* – pyramid_oereb.lib.readers.exclusion_of_liability.ExclusionOfLiabilityReader* – The exclusion of liability reader reader instance.

extract_reader¶

**Returns* – pyramid_oereb.lib.readers.extract.ExtractReader* – The extract reader instance.

filter_published_documents(record)[source]¶

Filter only published documents.

Parameters:(pyramid_oereb.lib.records.plr.PlrRecord or (record) – pyramid_oereb.lib.records.documents.DocumentRecord): The public law restriction or document record.
static get_legend_entries(inside_plrs, outside_plrs)[source]¶

We need to apply the right legend entries to each plr record which is intersecting the real estate. This means to make a topic wise grouping and find every legend entry which is on one hand not the same type code as the intersecting plr itself and on the other hand the same type code as the non intersecting one. We finally need to attach all this criteria matching legend entries to the intersecting one.

Parameters:
  • inside_plrs (list of pyramid_oereb.lib.records.plr.PlrRecord) – The PLR’s which are intersecting the real estate
  • outside_plrs (list of pyramid_oereb.lib.records.plr.PlrRecord) – The PLR’s which are in the BBOX of the view but not intersecting the real estate
Returns:

The updated records with the hopefully correct

legend entries assigned.
Return type:

list of pyramid_oereb.lib.records.plr.PlrRecord
glossary_reader¶

**Returns* – pyramid_oereb.lib.readers.glossary.GlossaryReader* – The glossary reader reader instance.

municipality_reader¶

**Returns* – pyramid_oereb.lib.readers.municipality.MunicipalityReader* – The municipality reader reader instance.

plr_sources¶

**Returns* – list of pyramid_oereb.lib.sources.plr.PlrStandardDatabaseSource* – The list of plr source instances.

plr_tolerance_check(extract)[source]¶

The function checking if the found plr results exceed the minimal surface or length value defined in the configuration and should therefor be represented in the extract or considered ‘false trues’ and be removed from the results.

Parameters:extract (pyramid_oereb.lib.records.extract.ExtractRecord) – The extract in it’s unvalidated form
Returns:Returns the updated extract
Return type:pyramid_oereb.lib.records.extract.ExtractRecord
process(real_estate, params, sld_url)[source]¶

Central processing method to hook in from webservice.

Parameters:
  • real_estate (pyramid_oereb.lib.records.real_estate.RealEstateRecord) – The real estate reader to obtain the real estates record.
  • params (pyramid_oereb.views.webservice.Parameter) – The parameters of the extract request.
  • sld_url (str) – The URL which provides the sld to style and filter the highlight of the real estate.
Returns:

The generated extract record.
Return type:

pyramid_oereb.lib.records.extract.ExtractRecord
real_estate_reader¶

**Returns* – pyramid_oereb.lib.readers.real_estate.RealEstateReader* – The real estate reader instance.

static view_service_handling(real_estate, images, format)[source]¶
Handles all view service related stuff. In the moment this is:
  • construction of the correct url (reference_wms) depending on the real estate
  • downloading of the image if parameter was set
Parameters:
  • real_estate (pyramid_oereb.lib.records.real_estate.RealEstateRecord) – The real estate record to be updated.
  • images (bool) – Switch whether the images should be downloaded or not.
  • format (string) – The format currently used. For ‘pdf’ format, the used map size will be adapted to the pdf format,
Returns:

The updated extract.
Return type:

pyramid_oereb.lib.records.real_estate.RealEstateRecord

Module readers¶

Module address¶

Class AddressReader¶
class pyramid_oereb.lib.readers.address.AddressReader(dotted_source_class_path, **params)[source]¶
read(street_name, zip_code, street_number)[source]¶

The central read accessor method to get all desired records from configured source.

Parameters:
  • street_name (unicode) – The name of the street for the desired address.
  • zip_code (int) – The postal zipcode for the desired address.
  • street_number (str) – The house or so called street number of the desired address.
Returns:

The list of found records.
Return type:

list of pyramid_oereb.lib.records.address.AddressRecord

  • municipality_logo (pyramid_oereb.lib.records.image.ImageRecord) – The municipality logo.

Module real_estate¶

Class RealEstateReader¶
class pyramid_oereb.lib.readers.real_estate.RealEstateReader(dotted_source_class_path, **params)[source]¶
read(nb_ident=None, number=None, egrid=None, geometry=None)[source]¶

The central read accessor method to get all desired records from configured source.

Parameters:
  • nb_ident (int or None) – The identification number of the desired real estate. This parameter is directlyrelated to the number parameter and both must be set! Combination will deliver only one result orcrashes.
  • number (str or None) – The number of parcel or also known real estate. This parameter is directlyrelated to the nb_ident parameter and both must be set! Combination will deliver only one result orcrashes.
  • or None) ((str) – The unique identifier of the desired real estate. This will deliver only one result orcrashes.
  • geometry (str) – A geometry as WKT string which is used to obtain intersected real estates. This maydeliver several results.
Returns:

the list of all found records
Return type:

list of pyramid_oereb.lib.records.real_estate.RealEstateRecord

Module extract¶

Class ExtractRecord¶
class pyramid_oereb.lib.records.extract.ExtractRecord(real_estate, logo_plr_cadastre, federal_logo, cantonal_logo, municipality_logo, plr_cadastre_authority, base_data, embeddable, exclusions_of_liability=None, glossaries=None, concerned_theme=None, not_concerned_theme=None, theme_without_data=None, general_information=None)[source]¶
concerned_theme = None¶

list of pyramid_oereb.lib.records.theme.ThemeRecord – List of concerned themes.

creation_date = None¶

datetime.datetime – The date and time of the extract creation.

electronic_signature = None¶

unicode or None – Digital signature for the extract.

extract_identifier = None¶

unicode – The extract identifier (UUID).

not_concerned_theme = None¶

list of pyramid_oereb.lib.records.theme.ThemeRecord – List of not concerned themes.

qr_code = None¶

binary or None – QR code for the extract as binary string.

theme_without_data = None¶

list of pyramid_oereb.lib.records.theme.ThemeRecord – List of themes without data.

Module geometry¶

Class GeometryRecord¶
class pyramid_oereb.lib.records.geometry.GeometryRecord(law_status, published_from, geom, geo_metadata=None, public_law_restriction=None, office=None)[source]¶
area¶

float or None – Returns the area of this geometry.

calculate(real_estate, min_length, min_area, length_unit, area_unit)[source]¶

Entry method for calculation. It checks if the geometry type of this instance is a geometry collection which has to be unpacked first in case of collection.

Parameters:
  • real_estate (pyramid_oereb.lib.records.real_estate.RealEstateRecord) – The real estate record.
  • min_length (float) – The threshold to consider or not a line element.
  • min_area (float) – The threshold to consider or not a surface element.
  • length_unit (unicode) – The thresholds unit for area calculation.
  • area_unit (unicode) – The thresholds unit for area calculation.
Returns:

True if intersection fits the limits.
Return type:

bool
length¶

float or None – Returns the length of this geometry.

published¶

bool – True if geometry is published.

Class PlrRecord¶
class pyramid_oereb.lib.records.plr.PlrRecord(theme, information, law_status, published_from, responsible_office, symbol, view_service, geometries, sub_theme=None, other_theme=None, type_code=None, type_code_list=None, basis=None, refinements=None, documents=None, info=None, min_length=0.0, min_area=0.0, length_unit=u'm', area_unit=u'm2', length_precision=2, area_precision=2, percentage_precision=1)[source]¶
area¶

decimal – Area of the restriction touching the property calculated by the processor.

length¶

**Returns* – float or None* – Returns the summed length of all related geometry records of this PLR.

part_in_percent = None¶

decimal – Part of the property area touched by the restriction in percent.

published¶

bool – True if PLR is published.

decimal – Ratio of geometrical area and area from land registry.

Module view_service¶

Class LegendEntryRecord¶
class pyramid_oereb.lib.records.view_service.LegendEntryRecord(symbol, legend_text, type_code, type_code_list, theme, sub_theme=None, other_theme=None)[source]¶
Class ViewServiceRecord¶
class pyramid_oereb.lib.records.view_service.ViewServiceRecord(reference_wms, legend_at_web=None, legends=None)[source]¶
download_wms_content()[source]¶

Simply downloads the image found behind the URL stored in the instance attribute “reference_wms”.

Raises:
  • LookupError – Raised if the response is not code 200
  • AttributeError – Raised if the URL itself isn’t valid at all.
get_full_wms_url(real_estate, format)[source]¶

Returns the WMS URL to get the image.

Parameters:
  • real_estate (pyramid_oereb.lob.records.real_estate.RealEstateRecord) – The Real Estate record.
  • format (string) – The format currently used. For ‘pdf’ format, the used map size will be adapted to the pdf format,
Returns:

The url used to query the WMS server.
Return type:

str
image = None¶

pyramid_oereb.lib.records.image.ImageRecord or None – Binary image content downloaded from WMS link.

unique_update_legends(legend)[source]¶
Uniquely append a legend to the legend entries. It checks if a legend entry with the same type code
already exists in the legends of this instance.
Parameters:legend (pyramid_oereb.lib.records.view_service.LegendEntryRecord) – The legend entry which should be append to the list.

Formats the date/time according to the specification.

Parameters:dt (datetime.dateordatetime.timeordatetime.datetime) – The datetime object.

get_localized_text(values)[source]¶

Parameters:values (str or dict) – The multilingual values encoded as JSON.
Returns:List of dictionaries containing the multilingual representation.

Module capabilities¶

Module xml_¶
Class Renderer¶
class pyramid_oereb.lib.renderer.capabilities.xml_.Renderer(info)[source]¶

Module extract¶

Module json_¶
Class Renderer¶
class pyramid_oereb.lib.renderer.extract.json_.Renderer(info)[source]¶
format_document(document)[source]¶

Formats a document record for rendering according to the federal specification. If the render is requested with a full flavour, it will render the textAtWeb into a Base64TextAtWeb field (for LegalProvisionRecord documents).

Parameters:document (pyramid_oereb.lib.records.documents.DocumentBaseRecord) – The document record to be formatted.
Returns:The formatted dictionary for rendering.
Return type:dict
format_embeddable(embeddable)[source]¶

Formats a embeddable record for rendering according to the specification.

Parameters:embeddable (pyramid_oereb.lib.records.embeddable.EmbeddableRecord) – The record to be formatted.
Returns:The formatted record for rendering.
Return type:dict

Class PlrStandardDatabaseSource¶
class pyramid_oereb.lib.sources.plr.PlrStandardDatabaseSource(**kwargs)[source]¶
static extract_geometry_collection_db(db_path, real_estate_geometry)[source]¶

Decides the geometry collection cases of geometric filter operations when the database contains multi geometries but the passed geometry does not. The multi geometry will be extracted to it’s sub parts for operation.

Parameters:
  • db_path (str) – The point separated string of schema_name.table_name.column_name from which we can construct a correct SQL statement.
  • real_estate_geometry (shapely.geometry.base.BaseGeometry) – The shapely geometry representation which is used for comparison.
Returns:

The clause element.
Return type:

sqlalchemy.sql.elements.BooleanClauseList
Raises:

HTTPBadRequest
read(real_estate, bbox)[source]¶

The read point which creates a extract, depending on a passed real estate.

Parameters:
  • real_estate (pyramid_oereb.lib.records.real_estate.RealEstateRecord) – The real estate in its record representation.
  • bbox (shapely.geometry.base.BaseGeometry) – The bbox to search the records.

Module real_estate¶

Class RealEstateBaseSource¶
class pyramid_oereb.lib.sources.real_estate.RealEstateBaseSource[source]¶
Class RealEstateDatabaseSource¶
class pyramid_oereb.lib.sources.real_estate.RealEstateDatabaseSource(**kwargs)[source]¶
read(nb_ident=None, number=None, egrid=None, geometry=None)[source]¶

Central method to read all plrs (geometry input) or explicitly one plr (nb_ident+number/egrid input).

Parameters:
  • nb_ident (int or None) – The identification number of the desired real estate. This parameter is directlyrelated to the number parameter and both must be set! Combination will deliver only one result orcrashes.
  • number (str or None) – The number of parcel or also known real estate. This parameter is directlyrelated to the nb_ident parameter and both must be set! Combination will deliver only one resultor crashes.
  • or None) ((str) – The unique identifier of the desired real estate. This will deliver only one result orcrashes.
  • geometry (str) – A geometry as WKT string which is used to obtain intersected real estates. This maydeliver several results.

pyramid_oereb.lib.url.url_to_base64(url)[source]¶

Request the document at the given url and return it as a base64 document.

Parameters:

url (str) – url to request and deliver as base64 document.
Returns:

the document as base64 string or None on empty urls
Return type:

base64 or str
Raises:
  • LookupError – Raised if the response is not code 200.
  • AttributeError – Raised if the URL itself isn’t valid at all.

Module standard¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.create_tables_from_standard_configuration(configuration_yaml_path, section='pyramid_oereb', tables_only=False, sql_file=None)[source]¶

Creates all schemas which are defined in the passed yaml file: <section>.<plrs>.[<plr>.<code>]. The code must be camel case. It will be transformed to snake case and used as schema name. Creates all tables inside the created schemas. This only affects the sqlalchemy models which are defined with the Base class from pyramid_oereb.standard.models.

Parameters:
  • configuration_yaml_path (str) – The absolute path to the yaml file which contains the plr definitions.
  • section (str) – The section in yaml file where the plrs are configured in. Default is ‘pyramid_oereb’.
  • tables_only (bool) – True to skip creation of schema. Default is False.
  • sql_file (file) – the file to generate. Default is None (in the database).
pyramid_oereb.standard.drop_tables_from_standard_configuration(configuration_yaml_path, section='pyramid_oereb')[source]¶

Drops all schemas which are defined in the passed yaml file: <section>.<plrs>.[<plr>.<code>]. The code must be camel case. It will be transformed to snake case and used as schema name. Drops all tables inside the created schemas.

Parameters:
  • configuration_yaml_path (str) – The absolute path to the yaml file which contains the plr definitions.
  • section (str) – The section in yaml file where the plrs are configured in. Default is ‘pyramid_oereb’.

Module create_tables¶

Module create_yaml¶

Module drop_tables¶

Module hook_methods¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.hook_methods.get_surveying_data_provider(real_estate)[source]¶
Parameters:real_estate (pyramid_oereb.lib.records.real_estate.RealEstateRecord) – The real estate for which the provider of the surveying data should be delivered.
Returns:
The provider who produced the used
surveying data.
Return type:provider (pyramid_oereb.lib.records.office.OfficeRecord)
pyramid_oereb.standard.hook_methods.get_surveying_data_update_date(real_estate)[source]¶

Gets the date of the latest update of the used survey data data for the situation map. The method you find here is only matching the standard configuration. But you can provide your own one if your configuration is different. The only thing you need to take into account is that the input of this method is always and only a real estate record. And the output of this method must be a datetime.date object.

Parameters:real_estate (pyramid_oereb.lib.records.real_estate.RealEstateRecord) – The real estate for which the last update date of the base data should be indicated
Returns:The date of the last update of the cadastral base data
Return type:update_date (datetime.datetime)
pyramid_oereb.standard.hook_methods.produce_sld_content(request)[source]¶

This is the standard hook method to provide the sld content. Of course you can set it to another one. For instance to use another template. Or to use other parameters to provide the correctly constructed SLD.

Note

What to know about this Method: REQUEST-Method: GET, parameters only as url parameters

When you are replacing this method take care that it has to accept a pyramid request as input and must deliver a valid SLD wrapped in a pyramid response instance as output. It is in your responsibility.

Parameters:request (pyramid.request.Request) – The request from the pyramid application.
Returns:The
Return type:pyramid.response.Response

Module models¶

Module airports_building_lines¶

This is a full representation of the data model defined by the federal definition.

It is representing the topic: Airports Building Lines

You can use it to produce a own new topic for the oereb eco system in the specifications shape. To be able to adapt this models to your own infrastructure you must implement the same attribute names! In fact that inheritance is not easily made you need to make your own classes and adapt them to your database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Article(**kwargs)[source]¶

A subclass of the document representing articles. Article in the sense of a law document. It is often described as a special part of the whole law document and reflects a dedicated content of this.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

number¶

str – The number which identifies this article in its parent document.

text¶

dict – A simple multilingual string to describe the article or give some related info.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document this article is taken from.

document_id

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Document – The dedicated relation to the document instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Availability(**kwargs)[source]¶

A simple bucket for achieving a switch per municipality. Here you can configure via the imported data if a public law restriction is available or not. You need to fill it with the data you provided in the app schemas municipality table (fosnr).

fosnr¶

int – The identifier of the municipality in your system (id_bfs = fosnr)

available¶

bool – The switch field to configure if this plr is available for the municipality or not. This field has direct influence on the applications behaviour. See documentation for more info.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.DataIntegration(**kwargs)[source]¶

The bucket to fill in the date when this whole schema was updated. It has a relation to the office to be able to find out who was the delivering instance.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

date¶

datetime.date – The date when this data set was delivered.

office_id¶

int – A foreign key which points to the actual office instance.

office¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Office – The actual office instance which the id points to.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Document(**kwargs)[source]¶

THE DOCUMENT This represents the main document in the whole system. It is specialized in some sub classes.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

title¶

dict – The multilingual title or if existing the short title ot his document.

office_title¶

dict – The multilingual official title of this document.

abbrevation¶

dict – The multilingual shortened version of the documents title.

official_number¶

str – The official number which uniquely identifies this document.

canton¶

str – The short version of the canton which this document is about. If this is None this is assumed to be a federal document.

municipality¶

int – The fosnr (=id bfs) of the municipality. If this is None it is assumed the document is related to the whole canton or even the confederation.

file¶

str – The document itself as a binary representation (PDF). It is string but BaseCode64 encoded.

office_id¶

int – The foreign key to the office which is in charge for this document.

responsible_office¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.DocumentBase(**kwargs)[source]¶

In the specification documents are cascaded in a inheritance way. So this representation is used to produce the addressable primary key and to provide the common document attributes.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

text_at_web¶

dict – A multilingual link which leads to the documents content in the web.

law_status¶

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from¶

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

type¶

unicode – This is a sqlalchemy related attribute to provide database table inheritance.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.DocumentReference(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for the relationship between documents.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which references to another document.

reference_document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which is referenced.

document¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Document – The dedicated relation to the document (which references) instance from database.

referenced_document¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Document – The dedicated relation to the document (which is referenced) instance from database.

article_numbers¶

str – A colon of article numbers which clarify the reference. This is a string separated by ‘|’.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.DocumentReferenceDefinition(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for the relationship between documents and the reference definition.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which is related to a reference definition.

reference_definition_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which is related to a reference definition.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Geometry(**kwargs)[source]¶

The dedicated model for all geometries in relation to their public law restriction.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

law_status¶

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from¶

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

geo_metadata¶

str – A link to the metadata which this geometry is based on which delivers machine readable response format (XML).

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction this geometry is related to.

public_law_restriction (pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines

.PublicLawRestriction): The dedicated relation to the public law restriction instance from database.

office_id¶

int – The foreign key to the office which is responsible to this public law restriction.

responsible_office¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

geom¶

geoalchemy2.types.Geometry – The geometry it’s self. For type information see geoalchemy2_. .. _geoalchemy2: https://geoalchemy-2.readthedocs.io/en/0.2.4/types.html docs dependent on the configured type. This concrete one is LINESTRING

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.LegalProvision(**kwargs)[source]¶

A subclass of the document representing legal provisions. It is a specialized class of document.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.LegendEntry(**kwargs)[source]¶

A class based legend system which is directly related to pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.ViewService.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

symbol¶

str – An image with represents the legend entry. This can be png or svg. It is string but BaseCode64 encoded.

legend_text¶

dict – Multilingual text to describe this legend entry.

type_code¶

str – Type code of the public law restriction which is represented by this legend entry.

type_code_list¶

str – List of all public law restrictions which are described through this legend entry.

topic¶

str – Statement to describe to which public law restriction this legend entry belongs.

sub_theme¶

str – Description for sub topics this legend entry might belonging to.

other_theme¶

str – A link to additional topics. It must be like the following patterns * ch.{canton}.{topic} * fl.{topic} * ch.{bfsnr}.{topic} This with {canton} as the official two letters short version (e.g.’BE’) {topic} as the name of the topic and {bfsnr} as the municipality id of the federal office of statistics.

view_service_id¶

int – The foreign key to the view service this legend entry is related to.

view_service¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.ViewService – The dedicated relation to the view service instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Office(**kwargs)[source]¶

The bucket to fill in all the offices you need to reference from public law restriction, document, geometry.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

name¶

dict – The multilingual name of the office.

office_at_web¶

str – A web accessible url to a presentation of this office.

uid¶

str – The uid of this office from https

line1¶

str – The first address line for this office.

line2¶

str – The second address line for this office.

street¶

str – The streets name of the offices address.

number¶

str – The number on street.

postal_code¶

int – The ZIP-code.

city¶

str – The name of the city.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.PublicLawRestriction(**kwargs)[source]¶

The container where you can fill in all your public law restrictions to the topic.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

information¶

dict – The multilingual textual representation of the public law restriction.

topic¶

str – Category for this public law restriction (name of the topic).

sub_theme¶

str – Textual explanation to subtype the topic attribute.

other_theme¶

str – A link to additional topics. It must be like the following patterns * ch.{canton}.{topic} * fl.{topic} * ch.{bfsnr}.{topic} This with {canton} as the official two letters short version (e.g.’BE’) {topic} as the name of the topic and {bfsnr} as the municipality id of the federal office of statistics.

type_code¶

str – Type code of the public law restriction machine readable based on the original data model of this public law restriction.

type_code_list¶

str – List of full range of type_codes for this public law restriction in a machine readable format.

law_status¶

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from¶

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

view_service_id¶

int – The foreign key to the view service this public law restriction is related to.

view_service¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.ViewService – The dedicated relation to the view service instance from database.

office_id¶

int – The foreign key to the office which is responsible to this public law restriction.

responsible_office¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.PublicLawRestrictionBase(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for public law restrictions which acts as a base for other public law restrictions.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which bases on another public law restriction.

public_law_restriction_base_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which is the base for the public law restriction.

plr¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which bases on) instance from database.

base¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which is the base) instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.PublicLawRestrictionDocument(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for the relationship between public law restrictions and documents.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which has relation to a document.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which has relation to the public law restriction.

plr¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction instance from database.

document¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.DocumentBase – The dedicated relation to the document instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.PublicLawRestrictionRefinement(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for public law restrictions which acts as a refinement for other public law restrictions.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which is refined by another public law restriction.

public_law_restriction_refinement_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which is the refinement of the public law restriction.

plr¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which refines) instance from database.

base¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which is refined) instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.ReferenceDefinition(**kwargs)[source]¶

The meta bucket for definitions which are directly related to a public law restriction in a common way or to the whole canton or a whole municipality. It is used to have a place to store general documents which are related to an extract but not directly on a special public law restriction situation.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

topic¶

str – The topic which this definition might be related to.

canton¶

str – The canton this definition is related to.

municipality¶

int – The municipality this definition is related to.

office_id¶

int – The foreign key constraint which the definition is related to.

responsible_office¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.ViewService(**kwargs)[source]¶

A view service aka WM(T)S which can deliver a cartographic representation via web.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

reference_wms¶

str – The actual url which leads to the desired cartographic representation.

legend_at_web¶

str – A link leading to a wms describing document (png).

Class Article¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Article(**kwargs)[source]

A subclass of the document representing articles. Article in the sense of a law document. It is often described as a special part of the whole law document and reflects a dedicated content of this.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

number

str – The number which identifies this article in its parent document.

text

dict – A simple multilingual string to describe the article or give some related info.

document_id

int – The foreign key to the document this article is taken from.

document_id

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Document – The dedicated relation to the document instance from database.

Class Availability¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Availability(**kwargs)[source]

A simple bucket for achieving a switch per municipality. Here you can configure via the imported data if a public law restriction is available or not. You need to fill it with the data you provided in the app schemas municipality table (fosnr).

fosnr

int – The identifier of the municipality in your system (id_bfs = fosnr)

available

bool – The switch field to configure if this plr is available for the municipality or not. This field has direct influence on the applications behaviour. See documentation for more info.

Class DataIntegration¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.DataIntegration(**kwargs)[source]

The bucket to fill in the date when this whole schema was updated. It has a relation to the office to be able to find out who was the delivering instance.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

date

datetime.date – The date when this data set was delivered.

office_id

int – A foreign key which points to the actual office instance.

office

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Office – The actual office instance which the id points to.

Class Document¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Document(**kwargs)[source]

THE DOCUMENT This represents the main document in the whole system. It is specialized in some sub classes.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

title

dict – The multilingual title or if existing the short title ot his document.

office_title

dict – The multilingual official title of this document.

abbrevation

dict – The multilingual shortened version of the documents title.

official_number

str – The official number which uniquely identifies this document.

canton

str – The short version of the canton which this document is about. If this is None this is assumed to be a federal document.

municipality

int – The fosnr (=id bfs) of the municipality. If this is None it is assumed the document is related to the whole canton or even the confederation.

file

str – The document itself as a binary representation (PDF). It is string but BaseCode64 encoded.

office_id

int – The foreign key to the office which is in charge for this document.

responsible_office

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

Class DocumentBase¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.DocumentBase(**kwargs)[source]

In the specification documents are cascaded in a inheritance way. So this representation is used to produce the addressable primary key and to provide the common document attributes.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

text_at_web

dict – A multilingual link which leads to the documents content in the web.

law_status

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

type

unicode – This is a sqlalchemy related attribute to provide database table inheritance.

Class DocumentReference¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.DocumentReference(**kwargs)[source]

Meta bucket (join table) for the relationship between documents.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

document_id

int – The foreign key to the document which references to another document.

reference_document_id

int – The foreign key to the document which is referenced.

document

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Document – The dedicated relation to the document (which references) instance from database.

referenced_document

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Document – The dedicated relation to the document (which is referenced) instance from database.

article_numbers

str – A colon of article numbers which clarify the reference. This is a string separated by ‘|’.

Class DocumentReferenceDefinition¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.DocumentReferenceDefinition(**kwargs)[source]

Meta bucket (join table) for the relationship between documents and the reference definition.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

document_id

int – The foreign key to the document which is related to a reference definition.

reference_definition_id

int – The foreign key to the document which is related to a reference definition.

Class Geometry¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Geometry(**kwargs)[source]

The dedicated model for all geometries in relation to their public law restriction.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

law_status

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

geo_metadata

str – A link to the metadata which this geometry is based on which delivers machine readable response format (XML).

public_law_restriction_id

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction this geometry is related to.

public_law_restriction (pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines

.PublicLawRestriction): The dedicated relation to the public law restriction instance from database.

office_id

int – The foreign key to the office which is responsible to this public law restriction.

responsible_office

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

geom

geoalchemy2.types.Geometry – The geometry it’s self. For type information see geoalchemy2_. .. _geoalchemy2: https://geoalchemy-2.readthedocs.io/en/0.2.4/types.html docs dependent on the configured type. This concrete one is LINESTRING

Class LegalProvision¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.LegalProvision(**kwargs)[source]

A subclass of the document representing legal provisions. It is a specialized class of document.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

Class LegendEntry¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.LegendEntry(**kwargs)[source]

A class based legend system which is directly related to pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.ViewService.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

symbol

str – An image with represents the legend entry. This can be png or svg. It is string but BaseCode64 encoded.

legend_text

dict – Multilingual text to describe this legend entry.

type_code

str – Type code of the public law restriction which is represented by this legend entry.

type_code_list

str – List of all public law restrictions which are described through this legend entry.

topic

str – Statement to describe to which public law restriction this legend entry belongs.

sub_theme

str – Description for sub topics this legend entry might belonging to.

other_theme

str – A link to additional topics. It must be like the following patterns * ch.{canton}.{topic} * fl.{topic} * ch.{bfsnr}.{topic} This with {canton} as the official two letters short version (e.g.’BE’) {topic} as the name of the topic and {bfsnr} as the municipality id of the federal office of statistics.

view_service_id

int – The foreign key to the view service this legend entry is related to.

view_service

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.ViewService – The dedicated relation to the view service instance from database.

Class Office¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Office(**kwargs)[source]

The bucket to fill in all the offices you need to reference from public law restriction, document, geometry.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

name

dict – The multilingual name of the office.

office_at_web

str – A web accessible url to a presentation of this office.

uid

str – The uid of this office from https

line1

str – The first address line for this office.

line2

str – The second address line for this office.

street

str – The streets name of the offices address.

number

str – The number on street.

postal_code

int – The ZIP-code.

city

str – The name of the city.

Class PublicLawRestriction¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.PublicLawRestriction(**kwargs)[source]

The container where you can fill in all your public law restrictions to the topic.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

information

dict – The multilingual textual representation of the public law restriction.

topic

str – Category for this public law restriction (name of the topic).

sub_theme

str – Textual explanation to subtype the topic attribute.

other_theme

str – A link to additional topics. It must be like the following patterns * ch.{canton}.{topic} * fl.{topic} * ch.{bfsnr}.{topic} This with {canton} as the official two letters short version (e.g.’BE’) {topic} as the name of the topic and {bfsnr} as the municipality id of the federal office of statistics.

type_code

str – Type code of the public law restriction machine readable based on the original data model of this public law restriction.

type_code_list

str – List of full range of type_codes for this public law restriction in a machine readable format.

law_status

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

view_service_id

int – The foreign key to the view service this public law restriction is related to.

view_service

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.ViewService – The dedicated relation to the view service instance from database.

office_id

int – The foreign key to the office which is responsible to this public law restriction.

responsible_office

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

Class PublicLawRestrictionBase¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.PublicLawRestrictionBase(**kwargs)[source]

Meta bucket (join table) for public law restrictions which acts as a base for other public law restrictions.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

public_law_restriction_id

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which bases on another public law restriction.

public_law_restriction_base_id

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which is the base for the public law restriction.

plr

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which bases on) instance from database.

base

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which is the base) instance from database.

Class PublicLawRestrictionDocument¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.PublicLawRestrictionDocument(**kwargs)[source]

Meta bucket (join table) for the relationship between public law restrictions and documents.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

public_law_restriction_id

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which has relation to a document.

document_id

int – The foreign key to the document which has relation to the public law restriction.

plr

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction instance from database.

document

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.DocumentBase – The dedicated relation to the document instance from database.

Class ViewService¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_building_lines.ViewService(**kwargs)[source]

A view service aka WM(T)S which can deliver a cartographic representation via web.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

reference_wms

str – The actual url which leads to the desired cartographic representation.

legend_at_web

str – A link leading to a wms describing document (png).

Module airports_project_planning_zones¶

This is a full representation of the data model defined by the federal definition.

It is representing the topic: Airports Project Planning Zones

You can use it to produce a own new topic for the oereb eco system in the specifications shape. To be able to adapt this models to your own infrastructure you must implement the same attribute names! In fact that inheritance is not easily made you need to make your own classes and adapt them to your database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.Article(**kwargs)[source]¶

A subclass of the document representing articles. Article in the sense of a law document. It is often described as a special part of the whole law document and reflects a dedicated content of this.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

number¶

str – The number which identifies this article in its parent document.

text¶

dict – A simple multilingual string to describe the article or give some related info.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document this article is taken from.

document_id

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.Document – The dedicated relation to the document instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.Availability(**kwargs)[source]¶

A simple bucket for achieving a switch per municipality. Here you can configure via the imported data if a public law restriction is available or not. You need to fill it with the data you provided in the app schemas municipality table (fosnr).

fosnr¶

int – The identifier of the municipality in your system (id_bfs = fosnr)

available¶

bool – The switch field to configure if this plr is available for the municipality or not. This field has direct influence on the applications behaviour. See documentation for more info.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.Document(**kwargs)[source]¶

THE DOCUMENT This represents the main document in the whole system. It is specialized in some sub classes.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

dict – The multilingual title or if existing the short title ot his document.

office_title¶

dict – The multilingual official title of this document.

abbrevation¶

dict – The multilingual shortened version of the documents title.

str – The official number which uniquely identifies this document.

canton¶

str – The short version of the canton which this document is about. If this is None this is assumed to be a federal document.

municipality¶

int – The fosnr (=id bfs) of the municipality. If this is None it is assumed the document is related to the whole canton or even the confederation.

file¶

office_id¶

int – The foreign key to the office which is in charge for this document.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.PublicLawRestrictionBase(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for public law restrictions which acts as a base for other public law restrictions.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which bases on another public law restriction.

public_law_restriction_base_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which is the base for the public law restriction.

plr¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which bases on) instance from database.

base¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which is the base) instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.PublicLawRestrictionDocument(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for the relationship between public law restrictions and documents.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which has relation to a document.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which has relation to the public law restriction.

plr¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction instance from database.

document¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.DocumentBase – The dedicated relation to the document instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.PublicLawRestrictionRefinement(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for public law restrictions which acts as a refinement for other public law restrictions.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which is refined by another public law restriction.

public_law_restriction_refinement_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which is the refinement of the public law restriction.

plr¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which refines) instance from database.

base¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which is refined) instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.ReferenceDefinition(**kwargs)[source]¶

The meta bucket for definitions which are directly related to a public law restriction in a common way or to the whole canton or a whole municipality. It is used to have a place to store general documents which are related to an extract but not directly on a special public law restriction situation.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

topic¶

str – The topic which this definition might be related to.

canton¶

str – The canton this definition is related to.

municipality¶

int – The municipality this definition is related to.

office_id¶

int – The foreign key constraint which the definition is related to.

responsible_office¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.ViewService(**kwargs)[source]¶

A view service aka WM(T)S which can deliver a cartographic representation via web.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

reference_wms¶

str – The actual url which leads to the desired cartographic representation.

legend_at_web¶

str – A link leading to a wms describing document (png).

Class Article¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.Article(**kwargs)[source]

A subclass of the document representing articles. Article in the sense of a law document. It is often described as a special part of the whole law document and reflects a dedicated content of this.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

number

str – The number which identifies this article in its parent document.

text

dict – A simple multilingual string to describe the article or give some related info.

document_id

int – The foreign key to the document this article is taken from.

document_id

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.Document – The dedicated relation to the document instance from database.

Class Availability¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.Availability(**kwargs)[source]

A simple bucket for achieving a switch per municipality. Here you can configure via the imported data if a public law restriction is available or not. You need to fill it with the data you provided in the app schemas municipality table (fosnr).

fosnr

int – The identifier of the municipality in your system (id_bfs = fosnr)

available

bool – The switch field to configure if this plr is available for the municipality or not. This field has direct influence on the applications behaviour. See documentation for more info.

Class DataIntegration¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.DataIntegration(**kwargs)[source]

The bucket to fill in the date when this whole schema was updated. It has a relation to the office to be able to find out who was the delivering instance.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

date

datetime.date – The date when this data set was delivered.

office_id

int – A foreign key which points to the actual office instance.

office

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.Office – The actual office instance which the id points to.

Class Document¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.Document(**kwargs)[source]

THE DOCUMENT This represents the main document in the whole system. It is specialized in some sub classes.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

title

dict – The multilingual title or if existing the short title ot his document.

office_title

dict – The multilingual official title of this document.

abbrevation

dict – The multilingual shortened version of the documents title.

official_number

str – The official number which uniquely identifies this document.

canton

str – The short version of the canton which this document is about. If this is None this is assumed to be a federal document.

municipality

int – The fosnr (=id bfs) of the municipality. If this is None it is assumed the document is related to the whole canton or even the confederation.

file

str – The document itself as a binary representation (PDF). It is string but BaseCode64 encoded.

office_id

int – The foreign key to the office which is in charge for this document.

responsible_office

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

Class DocumentBase¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.DocumentBase(**kwargs)[source]

In the specification documents are cascaded in a inheritance way. So this representation is used to produce the addressable primary key and to provide the common document attributes.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

text_at_web

dict – A multilingual link which leads to the documents content in the web.

law_status

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

type

unicode – This is a sqlalchemy related attribute to provide database table inheritance.

Class DocumentReference¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.DocumentReference(**kwargs)[source]

Meta bucket (join table) for the relationship between documents.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

document_id

int – The foreign key to the document which references to another document.

reference_document_id

int – The foreign key to the document which is referenced.

document

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.Document – The dedicated relation to the document (which references) instance from database.

referenced_document

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.Document – The dedicated relation to the document (which is referenced) instance from database.

article_numbers

str – A colon of article numbers which clarify the reference. This is a string separated by ‘|’.

Class DocumentReferenceDefinition¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.DocumentReferenceDefinition(**kwargs)[source]

Meta bucket (join table) for the relationship between documents and the reference definition.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

document_id

int – The foreign key to the document which is related to a reference definition.

reference_definition_id

int – The foreign key to the document which is related to a reference definition.

Class Geometry¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.Geometry(**kwargs)[source]

The dedicated model for all geometries in relation to their public law restriction.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

law_status

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

geo_metadata

str – A link to the metadata which this geometry is based on which delivers machine readable response format (XML).

public_law_restriction_id

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction this geometry is related to.

public_law_restriction (pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones

.PublicLawRestriction): The dedicated relation to the public law restriction instance from database.

office_id

int – The foreign key to the office which is responsible to this public law restriction.

responsible_office

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

geom

geoalchemy2.types.Geometry – The geometry it’s self. For type information see geoalchemy2_. .. _geoalchemy2: https://geoalchemy-2.readthedocs.io/en/0.2.4/types.html docs dependent on the configured type. This concrete one is POLYGON

Class LegalProvision¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.LegalProvision(**kwargs)[source]

A subclass of the document representing legal provisions. It is a specialized class of document.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

Class LegendEntry¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.LegendEntry(**kwargs)[source]

A class based legend system which is directly related to pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.ViewService.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

symbol

str – An image with represents the legend entry. This can be png or svg. It is string but BaseCode64 encoded.

legend_text

dict – Multilingual text to describe this legend entry.

type_code

str – Type code of the public law restriction which is represented by this legend entry.

type_code_list

str – List of all public law restrictions which are described through this legend entry.

topic

str – Statement to describe to which public law restriction this legend entry belongs.

sub_theme

str – Description for sub topics this legend entry might belonging to.

other_theme

str – A link to additional topics. It must be like the following patterns * ch.{canton}.{topic} * fl.{topic} * ch.{bfsnr}.{topic} This with {canton} as the official two letters short version (e.g.’BE’) {topic} as the name of the topic and {bfsnr} as the municipality id of the federal office of statistics.

view_service_id

int – The foreign key to the view service this legend entry is related to.

view_service

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.ViewService – The dedicated relation to the view service instance from database.

Class Office¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.Office(**kwargs)[source]

The bucket to fill in all the offices you need to reference from public law restriction, document, geometry.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

name

dict – The multilingual name of the office.

office_at_web

str – A web accessible url to a presentation of this office.

uid

str – The uid of this office from https

line1

str – The first address line for this office.

line2

str – The second address line for this office.

street

str – The streets name of the offices address.

number

str – The number on street.

postal_code

int – The ZIP-code.

city

str – The name of the city.

Class PublicLawRestriction¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.PublicLawRestriction(**kwargs)[source]

The container where you can fill in all your public law restrictions to the topic.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

information

dict – The multilingual textual representation of the public law restriction.

topic

str – Category for this public law restriction (name of the topic).

sub_theme

str – Textual explanation to subtype the topic attribute.

other_theme

str – A link to additional topics. It must be like the following patterns * ch.{canton}.{topic} * fl.{topic} * ch.{bfsnr}.{topic} This with {canton} as the official two letters short version (e.g.’BE’) {topic} as the name of the topic and {bfsnr} as the municipality id of the federal office of statistics.

type_code

str – Type code of the public law restriction machine readable based on the original data model of this public law restriction.

type_code_list

str – List of full range of type_codes for this public law restriction in a machine readable format.

law_status

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

view_service_id

int – The foreign key to the view service this public law restriction is related to.

view_service

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.ViewService – The dedicated relation to the view service instance from database.

office_id

int – The foreign key to the office which is responsible to this public law restriction.

responsible_office

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

Class ViewService¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_project_planning_zones.ViewService(**kwargs)[source]

A view service aka WM(T)S which can deliver a cartographic representation via web.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

reference_wms

str – The actual url which leads to the desired cartographic representation.

legend_at_web

str – A link leading to a wms describing document (png).

Module airports_security_zone_plans¶

This is a full representation of the data model defined by the federal definition.

It is representing the topic: Airports Security Zone Plans

You can use it to produce a own new topic for the oereb eco system in the specifications shape. To be able to adapt this models to your own infrastructure you must implement the same attribute names! In fact that inheritance is not easily made you need to make your own classes and adapt them to your database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_security_zone_plans.Article(**kwargs)[source]¶

A subclass of the document representing articles. Article in the sense of a law document. It is often described as a special part of the whole law document and reflects a dedicated content of this.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

number¶

str – The number which identifies this article in its parent document.

text¶

dict – A simple multilingual string to describe the article or give some related info.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document this article is taken from.

document_id

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_security_zone_plans.Document – The dedicated relation to the document instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.airports_security_zone_plans.Availability(**kwargs)[source]¶

A simple bucket for achieving a switch per municipality. Here you can configure via the imported data if a public law restriction is available or not. You need to fill it with the data you provided in the app schemas municipality table (fosnr).

fosnr¶

available¶

bool – The switch field to configure if this plr is available for the municipality or not. This field has direct influence on the applications behaviour. See documentation for more info.
