unicode – This is a sqlalchemy related attribute to provide database table inheritance.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.DocumentReference(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for the relationship between documents.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which references to another document.

reference_document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which is referenced.

document¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.Document – The dedicated relation to the document (which references) instance from database.

referenced_document¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.Document – The dedicated relation to the document (which is referenced) instance from database.

article_numbers¶

str – A colon of article numbers which clarify the reference. This is a string separated by ‘|’.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.DocumentReferenceDefinition(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for the relationship between documents and the reference definition.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which is related to a reference definition.

reference_definition_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which is related to a reference definition.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.Geometry(**kwargs)[source]¶

The dedicated model for all geometries in relation to their public law restriction.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

law_status¶

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from¶

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

geo_metadata¶

str – A link to the metadata which this geometry is based on which delivers machine readable response format (XML).

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction this geometry is related to.

public_law_restriction (pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites

.PublicLawRestriction): The dedicated relation to the public law restriction instance from database.

office_id¶

int – The foreign key to the office which is responsible to this public law restriction.

responsible_office¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

geom¶

geoalchemy2.types.Geometry – The geometry it’s self. For type information see geoalchemy2_. .. _geoalchemy2: https://geoalchemy-2.readthedocs.io/en/0.2.4/types.html docs dependent on the configured type. This concrete one is GEOMETRYCOLLECTION

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.LegalProvision(**kwargs)[source]¶

A subclass of the document representing legal provisions. It is a specialized class of document.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.LegendEntry(**kwargs)[source]¶

A class based legend system which is directly related to pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.ViewService.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

symbol¶

str – An image with represents the legend entry. This can be png or svg. It is string but BaseCode64 encoded.

legend_text¶

dict – Multilingual text to describe this legend entry.

type_code¶

str – Type code of the public law restriction which is represented by this legend entry.

type_code_list¶

str – List of all public law restrictions which are described through this legend entry.

topic¶

str – Statement to describe to which public law restriction this legend entry belongs.

sub_theme¶

str – Description for sub topics this legend entry might belonging to.

other_theme¶

str – A link to additional topics. It must be like the following patterns * ch.{canton}.{topic} * fl.{topic} * ch.{bfsnr}.{topic} This with {canton} as the official two letters short version (e.g.’BE’) {topic} as the name of the topic and {bfsnr} as the municipality id of the federal office of statistics.

view_service_id¶

int – The foreign key to the view service this legend entry is related to.

view_service¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.ViewService – The dedicated relation to the view service instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.Office(**kwargs)[source]¶

The bucket to fill in all the offices you need to reference from public law restriction, document, geometry.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

name¶

dict – The multilingual name of the office.

office_at_web¶

str – A web accessible url to a presentation of this office.

uid¶

str – The uid of this office from https

line1¶

str – The first address line for this office.

line2¶

str – The second address line for this office.

street¶

str – The streets name of the offices address.

number¶

str – The number on street.

postal_code¶

int – The ZIP-code.

city¶

str – The name of the city.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.PublicLawRestriction(**kwargs)[source]¶

The container where you can fill in all your public law restrictions to the topic.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

information¶

dict – The multilingual textual representation of the public law restriction.

topic¶

str – Category for this public law restriction (name of the topic).

sub_theme¶

str – Textual explanation to subtype the topic attribute.

other_theme¶

str – A link to additional topics. It must be like the following patterns * ch.{canton}.{topic} * fl.{topic} * ch.{bfsnr}.{topic} This with {canton} as the official two letters short version (e.g.’BE’) {topic} as the name of the topic and {bfsnr} as the municipality id of the federal office of statistics.

type_code¶

str – Type code of the public law restriction machine readable based on the original data model of this public law restriction.

type_code_list¶

str – List of full range of type_codes for this public law restriction in a machine readable format.

law_status¶

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from¶

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

view_service_id¶

int – The foreign key to the view service this public law restriction is related to.

view_service¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.ViewService – The dedicated relation to the view service instance from database.

office_id¶

int – The foreign key to the office which is responsible to this public law restriction.

responsible_office¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.PublicLawRestrictionBase(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for public law restrictions which acts as a base for other public law restrictions.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which bases on another public law restriction.

public_law_restriction_base_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which is the base for the public law restriction.

plr¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which bases on) instance from database.

base¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which is the base) instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.PublicLawRestrictionDocument(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for the relationship between public law restrictions and documents.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which has relation to a document.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which has relation to the public law restriction.

plr¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction instance from database.

document¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.DocumentBase – The dedicated relation to the document instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.PublicLawRestrictionRefinement(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for public law restrictions which acts as a refinement for other public law restrictions.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which is refined by another public law restriction.

public_law_restriction_refinement_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which is the refinement of the public law restriction.

plr¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which refines) instance from database.

base¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which is refined) instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.ReferenceDefinition(**kwargs)[source]¶

The meta bucket for definitions which are directly related to a public law restriction in a common way or to the whole canton or a whole municipality. It is used to have a place to store general documents which are related to an extract but not directly on a special public law restriction situation.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

topic¶

str – The topic which this definition might be related to.

canton¶

str – The canton this definition is related to.

municipality¶

int – The municipality this definition is related to.

office_id¶

int – The foreign key constraint which the definition is related to.

responsible_office¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.ViewService(**kwargs)[source]¶

A view service aka WM(T)S which can deliver a cartographic representation via web.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

reference_wms¶

str – The actual url which leads to the desired cartographic representation.

legend_at_web¶

str – A link leading to a wms describing document (png).

Class Article¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.Article(**kwargs)[source]

A subclass of the document representing articles. Article in the sense of a law document. It is often described as a special part of the whole law document and reflects a dedicated content of this.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

number

str – The number which identifies this article in its parent document.

text

dict – A simple multilingual string to describe the article or give some related info.

document_id

int – The foreign key to the document this article is taken from.

document_id

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.Document – The dedicated relation to the document instance from database.

Class Availability¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.Availability(**kwargs)[source]

A simple bucket for achieving a switch per municipality. Here you can configure via the imported data if a public law restriction is available or not. You need to fill it with the data you provided in the app schemas municipality table (fosnr).

fosnr

int – The identifier of the municipality in your system (id_bfs = fosnr)

available

bool – The switch field to configure if this plr is available for the municipality or not. This field has direct influence on the applications behaviour. See documentation for more info.

Class DataIntegration¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.DataIntegration(**kwargs)[source]

The bucket to fill in the date when this whole schema was updated. It has a relation to the office to be able to find out who was the delivering instance.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

date

datetime.date – The date when this data set was delivered.

office_id

int – A foreign key which points to the actual office instance.

office

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.Office – The actual office instance which the id points to.

Class Document¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.Document(**kwargs)[source]

THE DOCUMENT This represents the main document in the whole system. It is specialized in some sub classes.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

title

dict – The multilingual title or if existing the short title ot his document.

office_title

dict – The multilingual official title of this document.

abbrevation

dict – The multilingual shortened version of the documents title.

official_number

str – The official number which uniquely identifies this document.

canton

str – The short version of the canton which this document is about. If this is None this is assumed to be a federal document.

municipality

int – The fosnr (=id bfs) of the municipality. If this is None it is assumed the document is related to the whole canton or even the confederation.

file

str – The document itself as a binary representation (PDF). It is string but BaseCode64 encoded.

office_id

int – The foreign key to the office which is in charge for this document.

responsible_office

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

Class DocumentBase¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.contaminated_sites.DocumentBase(**kwargs)[source]

In the specification documents are cascaded in a inheritance way. So this representation is used to produce the addressable primary key and to provide the common document attributes.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

text_at_web

dict – A multilingual link which leads to the documents content in the web.

law_status

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

type

unicode – This is a sqlalchemy related attribute to provide database table inheritance.

Class ViewService¶

A view service aka WM(T)S which can deliver a cartographic representation via web.

id

str – The actual url which leads to the desired cartographic representation.

legend_at_web

str – A link leading to a wms describing document (png).

Module forest_distance_lines¶

This is a full representation of the data model defined by the federal definition.

It is representing the topic: Forest Distance Lines

You can use it to produce a own new topic for the oereb eco system in the specifications shape. To be able to adapt this models to your own infrastructure you must implement the same attribute names! In fact that inheritance is not easily made you need to make your own classes and adapt them to your database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.Article(**kwargs)[source]¶

A subclass of the document representing articles. Article in the sense of a law document. It is often described as a special part of the whole law document and reflects a dedicated content of this.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

number¶

str – The number which identifies this article in its parent document.

text¶

dict – A simple multilingual string to describe the article or give some related info.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document this article is taken from.

document_id

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.Document – The dedicated relation to the document instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.Availability(**kwargs)[source]¶

A simple bucket for achieving a switch per municipality. Here you can configure via the imported data if a public law restriction is available or not. You need to fill it with the data you provided in the app schemas municipality table (fosnr).

fosnr¶

int – The identifier of the municipality in your system (id_bfs = fosnr)

available¶

bool – The switch field to configure if this plr is available for the municipality or not. This field has direct influence on the applications behaviour. See documentation for more info.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.DataIntegration(**kwargs)[source]¶

The bucket to fill in the date when this whole schema was updated. It has a relation to the office to be able to find out who was the delivering instance.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.Office – The actual office instance which the id points to.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.Document(**kwargs)[source]¶

THE DOCUMENT This represents the main document in the whole system. It is specialized in some sub classes.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

dict – The multilingual title or if existing the short title ot his document.

dict – The multilingual official title of this document.

dict – The multilingual shortened version of the documents title.

str – The official number which uniquely identifies this document.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.DocumentBase(**kwargs)[source]¶

In the specification documents are cascaded in a inheritance way. So this representation is used to produce the addressable primary key and to provide the common document attributes.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

text_at_web¶

dict – A multilingual link which leads to the documents content in the web.

law_status¶

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from¶

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

type¶

unicode – This is a sqlalchemy related attribute to provide database table inheritance.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.DocumentReference(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for the relationship between documents.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which references to another document.

reference_document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which is referenced.

document¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.Document – The dedicated relation to the document (which references) instance from database.

referenced_document¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.Document – The dedicated relation to the document (which is referenced) instance from database.

article_numbers¶

str – A colon of article numbers which clarify the reference. This is a string separated by ‘|’.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.DocumentReferenceDefinition(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for the relationship between documents and the reference definition.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which is related to a reference definition.

reference_definition_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which is related to a reference definition.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.Geometry(**kwargs)[source]¶

The dedicated model for all geometries in relation to their public law restriction.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

law_status¶

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from¶

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

geo_metadata¶

str – A link to the metadata which this geometry is based on which delivers machine readable response format (XML).

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction this geometry is related to.

public_law_restriction (pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines

.PublicLawRestriction): The dedicated relation to the public law restriction instance from database.

office_id¶

int – The foreign key to the office which is responsible to this public law restriction.

responsible_office¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

geom¶

geoalchemy2.types.Geometry – The geometry it’s self. For type information see geoalchemy2_. .. _geoalchemy2: https://geoalchemy-2.readthedocs.io/en/0.2.4/types.html docs dependent on the configured type. This concrete one is LINESTRING

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.LegalProvision(**kwargs)[source]¶

A subclass of the document representing legal provisions. It is a specialized class of document.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.LegendEntry(**kwargs)[source]¶

A class based legend system which is directly related to pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.ViewService.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

symbol¶

str – An image with represents the legend entry. This can be png or svg. It is string but BaseCode64 encoded.

legend_text¶

dict – Multilingual text to describe this legend entry.

type_code¶

str – Type code of the public law restriction which is represented by this legend entry.

type_code_list¶

str – List of all public law restrictions which are described through this legend entry.

topic¶

str – Statement to describe to which public law restriction this legend entry belongs.

sub_theme¶

str – Description for sub topics this legend entry might belonging to.

other_theme¶

str – A link to additional topics. It must be like the following patterns * ch.{canton}.{topic} * fl.{topic} * ch.{bfsnr}.{topic} This with {canton} as the official two letters short version (e.g.’BE’) {topic} as the name of the topic and {bfsnr} as the municipality id of the federal office of statistics.

view_service_id¶

int – The foreign key to the view service this legend entry is related to.

view_service¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.ViewService – The dedicated relation to the view service instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.Office(**kwargs)[source]¶

The bucket to fill in all the offices you need to reference from public law restriction, document, geometry.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

name¶

dict – The multilingual name of the office.

office_at_web¶

str – A web accessible url to a presentation of this office.

uid¶

str – The uid of this office from https

line1¶

str – The first address line for this office.

line2¶

str – The second address line for this office.

street¶

str – The streets name of the offices address.

number¶

str – The number on street.

postal_code¶

int – The ZIP-code.

city¶

str – The name of the city.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.PublicLawRestriction(**kwargs)[source]¶

The container where you can fill in all your public law restrictions to the topic.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

information¶

dict – The multilingual textual representation of the public law restriction.

topic¶

str – Category for this public law restriction (name of the topic).

sub_theme¶

str – Textual explanation to subtype the topic attribute.

other_theme¶

str – A link to additional topics. It must be like the following patterns * ch.{canton}.{topic} * fl.{topic} * ch.{bfsnr}.{topic} This with {canton} as the official two letters short version (e.g.’BE’) {topic} as the name of the topic and {bfsnr} as the municipality id of the federal office of statistics.

type_code¶

str – Type code of the public law restriction machine readable based on the original data model of this public law restriction.

type_code_list¶

str – List of full range of type_codes for this public law restriction in a machine readable format.

law_status¶

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from¶

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

view_service_id¶

int – The foreign key to the view service this public law restriction is related to.

view_service¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.ViewService – The dedicated relation to the view service instance from database.

office_id¶

int – The foreign key to the office which is responsible to this public law restriction.

responsible_office¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.PublicLawRestrictionBase(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for public law restrictions which acts as a base for other public law restrictions.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which bases on another public law restriction.

public_law_restriction_base_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which is the base for the public law restriction.

plr¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which bases on) instance from database.

base¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which is the base) instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.PublicLawRestrictionDocument(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for the relationship between public law restrictions and documents.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which has relation to a document.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which has relation to the public law restriction.

plr¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction instance from database.

document¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.DocumentBase – The dedicated relation to the document instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.PublicLawRestrictionRefinement(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for public law restrictions which acts as a refinement for other public law restrictions.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which is refined by another public law restriction.

public_law_restriction_refinement_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which is the refinement of the public law restriction.

plr¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which refines) instance from database.

base¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which is refined) instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.ReferenceDefinition(**kwargs)[source]¶

The meta bucket for definitions which are directly related to a public law restriction in a common way or to the whole canton or a whole municipality. It is used to have a place to store general documents which are related to an extract but not directly on a special public law restriction situation.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

topic¶

str – The topic which this definition might be related to.

canton¶

str – The canton this definition is related to.

municipality¶

int – The municipality this definition is related to.

office_id¶

int – The foreign key constraint which the definition is related to.

responsible_office¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.ViewService(**kwargs)[source]¶

A view service aka WM(T)S which can deliver a cartographic representation via web.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

reference_wms¶

str – The actual url which leads to the desired cartographic representation.

legend_at_web¶

str – A link leading to a wms describing document (png).

Class Article¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.Article(**kwargs)[source]

A subclass of the document representing articles. Article in the sense of a law document. It is often described as a special part of the whole law document and reflects a dedicated content of this.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

number

str – The number which identifies this article in its parent document.

text

dict – A simple multilingual string to describe the article or give some related info.

document_id

int – The foreign key to the document this article is taken from.

document_id

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.Document – The dedicated relation to the document instance from database.

Class Availability¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.Availability(**kwargs)[source]

A simple bucket for achieving a switch per municipality. Here you can configure via the imported data if a public law restriction is available or not. You need to fill it with the data you provided in the app schemas municipality table (fosnr).

fosnr

int – The identifier of the municipality in your system (id_bfs = fosnr)

available

bool – The switch field to configure if this plr is available for the municipality or not. This field has direct influence on the applications behaviour. See documentation for more info.

Class DataIntegration¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.DataIntegration(**kwargs)[source]

The bucket to fill in the date when this whole schema was updated. It has a relation to the office to be able to find out who was the delivering instance.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

date

datetime.date – The date when this data set was delivered.

office_id

int – A foreign key which points to the actual office instance.

office

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.Office – The actual office instance which the id points to.

Class Document¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.Document(**kwargs)[source]

THE DOCUMENT This represents the main document in the whole system. It is specialized in some sub classes.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

title

dict – The multilingual title or if existing the short title ot his document.

office_title

dict – The multilingual official title of this document.

abbrevation

dict – The multilingual shortened version of the documents title.

official_number

str – The official number which uniquely identifies this document.

canton

str – The short version of the canton which this document is about. If this is None this is assumed to be a federal document.

municipality

int – The fosnr (=id bfs) of the municipality. If this is None it is assumed the document is related to the whole canton or even the confederation.

file

str – The document itself as a binary representation (PDF). It is string but BaseCode64 encoded.

office_id

int – The foreign key to the office which is in charge for this document.

responsible_office

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

Class DocumentBase¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.DocumentBase(**kwargs)[source]

In the specification documents are cascaded in a inheritance way. So this representation is used to produce the addressable primary key and to provide the common document attributes.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

text_at_web

dict – A multilingual link which leads to the documents content in the web.

law_status

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

type

unicode – This is a sqlalchemy related attribute to provide database table inheritance.

Class ViewService¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_distance_lines.ViewService(**kwargs)[source]

A view service aka WM(T)S which can deliver a cartographic representation via web.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

reference_wms

str – The actual url which leads to the desired cartographic representation.

legend_at_web

str – A link leading to a wms describing document (png).

Module forest_perimeters¶

This is a full representation of the data model defined by the federal definition.

It is representing the topic: Forest Perimeters

You can use it to produce a own new topic for the oereb eco system in the specifications shape. To be able to adapt this models to your own infrastructure you must implement the same attribute names! In fact that inheritance is not easily made you need to make your own classes and adapt them to your database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.Article(**kwargs)[source]¶

A subclass of the document representing articles. Article in the sense of a law document. It is often described as a special part of the whole law document and reflects a dedicated content of this.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

number¶

str – The number which identifies this article in its parent document.

text¶

dict – A simple multilingual string to describe the article or give some related info.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document this article is taken from.

document_id

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.Document – The dedicated relation to the document instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.Availability(**kwargs)[source]¶

A simple bucket for achieving a switch per municipality. Here you can configure via the imported data if a public law restriction is available or not. You need to fill it with the data you provided in the app schemas municipality table (fosnr).

fosnr¶

int – The identifier of the municipality in your system (id_bfs = fosnr)

available¶

bool – The switch field to configure if this plr is available for the municipality or not. This field has direct influence on the applications behaviour. See documentation for more info.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.DataIntegration(**kwargs)[source]¶

The bucket to fill in the date when this whole schema was updated. It has a relation to the office to be able to find out who was the delivering instance.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.Office – The actual office instance which the id points to.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.Document(**kwargs)[source]¶

THE DOCUMENT This represents the main document in the whole system. It is specialized in some sub classes.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

title¶

dict – The multilingual title or if existing the short title ot his document.

office_title¶

dict – The multilingual official title of this document.

abbrevation¶

dict – The multilingual shortened version of the documents title.

official_number¶

str – The official number which uniquely identifies this document.

canton¶

str – The short version of the canton which this document is about. If this is None this is assumed to be a federal document.

municipality¶

int – The fosnr (=id bfs) of the municipality. If this is None it is assumed the document is related to the whole canton or even the confederation.

file¶

str – The document itself as a binary representation (PDF). It is string but BaseCode64 encoded.

office_id¶

int – The foreign key to the office which is in charge for this document.

responsible_office¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.DocumentBase(**kwargs)[source]¶

In the specification documents are cascaded in a inheritance way. So this representation is used to produce the addressable primary key and to provide the common document attributes.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

text_at_web¶

dict – A multilingual link which leads to the documents content in the web.

law_status¶

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from¶

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

type¶

unicode – This is a sqlalchemy related attribute to provide database table inheritance.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.DocumentReference(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for the relationship between documents.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which references to another document.

reference_document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which is referenced.

document¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.Document – The dedicated relation to the document (which references) instance from database.

referenced_document¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.Document – The dedicated relation to the document (which is referenced) instance from database.

article_numbers¶

str – A colon of article numbers which clarify the reference. This is a string separated by ‘|’.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.DocumentReferenceDefinition(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for the relationship between documents and the reference definition.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which is related to a reference definition.

reference_definition_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which is related to a reference definition.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.Geometry(**kwargs)[source]¶

The dedicated model for all geometries in relation to their public law restriction.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

law_status¶

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from¶

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

geo_metadata¶

str – A link to the metadata which this geometry is based on which delivers machine readable response format (XML).

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction this geometry is related to.

public_law_restriction (pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters

.PublicLawRestriction): The dedicated relation to the public law restriction instance from database.

office_id¶

int – The foreign key to the office which is responsible to this public law restriction.

responsible_office¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

geom¶

geoalchemy2.types.Geometry – The geometry it’s self. For type information see geoalchemy2_. .. _geoalchemy2: https://geoalchemy-2.readthedocs.io/en/0.2.4/types.html docs dependent on the configured type. This concrete one is LINESTRING

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.LegalProvision(**kwargs)[source]¶

A subclass of the document representing legal provisions. It is a specialized class of document.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.LegendEntry(**kwargs)[source]¶

A class based legend system which is directly related to pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.ViewService.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

symbol¶

str – An image with represents the legend entry. This can be png or svg. It is string but BaseCode64 encoded.

legend_text¶

dict – Multilingual text to describe this legend entry.

type_code¶

str – Type code of the public law restriction which is represented by this legend entry.

type_code_list¶

str – List of all public law restrictions which are described through this legend entry.

topic¶

str – Statement to describe to which public law restriction this legend entry belongs.

sub_theme¶

str – Description for sub topics this legend entry might belonging to.

other_theme¶

str – A link to additional topics. It must be like the following patterns * ch.{canton}.{topic} * fl.{topic} * ch.{bfsnr}.{topic} This with {canton} as the official two letters short version (e.g.’BE’) {topic} as the name of the topic and {bfsnr} as the municipality id of the federal office of statistics.

view_service_id¶

int – The foreign key to the view service this legend entry is related to.

view_service¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.ViewService – The dedicated relation to the view service instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.Office(**kwargs)[source]¶

The bucket to fill in all the offices you need to reference from public law restriction, document, geometry.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

name¶

dict – The multilingual name of the office.

office_at_web¶

str – A web accessible url to a presentation of this office.

uid¶

str – The uid of this office from https

line1¶

str – The first address line for this office.

line2¶

str – The second address line for this office.

street¶

str – The streets name of the offices address.

number¶

str – The number on street.

postal_code¶

int – The ZIP-code.

city¶

str – The name of the city.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.PublicLawRestriction(**kwargs)[source]¶

The container where you can fill in all your public law restrictions to the topic.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

information¶

dict – The multilingual textual representation of the public law restriction.

topic¶

str – Category for this public law restriction (name of the topic).

sub_theme¶

str – Textual explanation to subtype the topic attribute.

other_theme¶

str – A link to additional topics. It must be like the following patterns * ch.{canton}.{topic} * fl.{topic} * ch.{bfsnr}.{topic} This with {canton} as the official two letters short version (e.g.’BE’) {topic} as the name of the topic and {bfsnr} as the municipality id of the federal office of statistics.

type_code¶

str – Type code of the public law restriction machine readable based on the original data model of this public law restriction.

type_code_list¶

str – List of full range of type_codes for this public law restriction in a machine readable format.

law_status¶

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from¶

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

view_service_id¶

int – The foreign key to the view service this public law restriction is related to.

view_service¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.ViewService – The dedicated relation to the view service instance from database.

office_id¶

int – The foreign key to the office which is responsible to this public law restriction.

responsible_office¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.PublicLawRestrictionBase(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for public law restrictions which acts as a base for other public law restrictions.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which bases on another public law restriction.

public_law_restriction_base_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which is the base for the public law restriction.

plr¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which bases on) instance from database.

base¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which is the base) instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.PublicLawRestrictionDocument(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for the relationship between public law restrictions and documents.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which has relation to a document.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which has relation to the public law restriction.

plr¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction instance from database.

document¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.DocumentBase – The dedicated relation to the document instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.PublicLawRestrictionRefinement(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for public law restrictions which acts as a refinement for other public law restrictions.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which is refined by another public law restriction.

public_law_restriction_refinement_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which is the refinement of the public law restriction.

plr¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which refines) instance from database.

base¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which is refined) instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.ReferenceDefinition(**kwargs)[source]¶

The meta bucket for definitions which are directly related to a public law restriction in a common way or to the whole canton or a whole municipality. It is used to have a place to store general documents which are related to an extract but not directly on a special public law restriction situation.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

topic¶

str – The topic which this definition might be related to.

canton¶

str – The canton this definition is related to.

municipality¶

int – The municipality this definition is related to.

office_id¶

int – The foreign key constraint which the definition is related to.

responsible_office¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.ViewService(**kwargs)[source]¶

A view service aka WM(T)S which can deliver a cartographic representation via web.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

reference_wms¶

str – The actual url which leads to the desired cartographic representation.

legend_at_web¶

str – A link leading to a wms describing document (png).

Class Article¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.Article(**kwargs)[source]

A subclass of the document representing articles. Article in the sense of a law document. It is often described as a special part of the whole law document and reflects a dedicated content of this.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

number

str – The number which identifies this article in its parent document.

text

dict – A simple multilingual string to describe the article or give some related info.

document_id

int – The foreign key to the document this article is taken from.

document_id

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.Document – The dedicated relation to the document instance from database.

Class Availability¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.Availability(**kwargs)[source]

A simple bucket for achieving a switch per municipality. Here you can configure via the imported data if a public law restriction is available or not. You need to fill it with the data you provided in the app schemas municipality table (fosnr).

fosnr

int – The identifier of the municipality in your system (id_bfs = fosnr)

available

bool – The switch field to configure if this plr is available for the municipality or not. This field has direct influence on the applications behaviour. See documentation for more info.

Class DataIntegration¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.DataIntegration(**kwargs)[source]

The bucket to fill in the date when this whole schema was updated. It has a relation to the office to be able to find out who was the delivering instance.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

date

datetime.date – The date when this data set was delivered.

office_id

int – A foreign key which points to the actual office instance.

office

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.Office – The actual office instance which the id points to.

Class Document¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.Document(**kwargs)[source]

THE DOCUMENT This represents the main document in the whole system. It is specialized in some sub classes.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

title

dict – The multilingual title or if existing the short title ot his document.

office_title

dict – The multilingual official title of this document.

abbrevation

dict – The multilingual shortened version of the documents title.

official_number

str – The official number which uniquely identifies this document.

canton

str – The short version of the canton which this document is about. If this is None this is assumed to be a federal document.

municipality

int – The fosnr (=id bfs) of the municipality. If this is None it is assumed the document is related to the whole canton or even the confederation.

file

str – The document itself as a binary representation (PDF). It is string but BaseCode64 encoded.

office_id

int – The foreign key to the office which is in charge for this document.

responsible_office

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

Class DocumentBase¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.forest_perimeters.DocumentBase(**kwargs)[source]

In the specification documents are cascaded in a inheritance way. So this representation is used to produce the addressable primary key and to provide the common document attributes.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

text_at_web

dict – A multilingual link which leads to the documents content in the web.

law_status

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

type

unicode – This is a sqlalchemy related attribute to provide database table inheritance.

Class ViewService¶

A view service aka WM(T)S which can deliver a cartographic representation via web.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

reference_wms

str – The actual url which leads to the desired cartographic representation.

legend_at_web

str – A link leading to a wms describing document (png).

Module groundwater_protection_sites¶

This is a full representation of the data model defined by the federal definition.

It is representing the topic: Groundwater Protection Sites

You can use it to produce a own new topic for the oereb eco system in the specifications shape. To be able to adapt this models to your own infrastructure you must implement the same attribute names! In fact that inheritance is not easily made you need to make your own classes and adapt them to your database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.Article(**kwargs)[source]¶

A subclass of the document representing articles. Article in the sense of a law document. It is often described as a special part of the whole law document and reflects a dedicated content of this.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

number¶

str – The number which identifies this article in its parent document.

text¶

dict – A simple multilingual string to describe the article or give some related info.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document this article is taken from.

document_id

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.Document – The dedicated relation to the document instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.Availability(**kwargs)[source]¶

A simple bucket for achieving a switch per municipality. Here you can configure via the imported data if a public law restriction is available or not. You need to fill it with the data you provided in the app schemas municipality table (fosnr).

fosnr¶

int – The identifier of the municipality in your system (id_bfs = fosnr)

available¶

bool – The switch field to configure if this plr is available for the municipality or not. This field has direct influence on the applications behaviour. See documentation for more info.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.DataIntegration(**kwargs)[source]¶

The bucket to fill in the date when this whole schema was updated. It has a relation to the office to be able to find out who was the delivering instance.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

date¶

datetime.date – The date when this data set was delivered.

int – A foreign key which points to the actual office instance.

office¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.Office – The actual office instance which the id points to.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.Document(**kwargs)[source]¶

THE DOCUMENT This represents the main document in the whole system. It is specialized in some sub classes.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

title¶

dict – The multilingual title or if existing the short title ot his document.

office_title¶

dict – The multilingual official title of this document.

abbrevation¶

dict – The multilingual shortened version of the documents title.

official_number¶

str – The official number which uniquely identifies this document.

canton¶

str – The short version of the canton which this document is about. If this is None this is assumed to be a federal document.

municipality¶

int – The fosnr (=id bfs) of the municipality. If this is None it is assumed the document is related to the whole canton or even the confederation.

file¶

str – The document itself as a binary representation (PDF). It is string but BaseCode64 encoded.

office_id¶

int – The foreign key to the office which is in charge for this document.

responsible_office¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.DocumentBase(**kwargs)[source]¶

In the specification documents are cascaded in a inheritance way. So this representation is used to produce the addressable primary key and to provide the common document attributes.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

text_at_web¶

dict – A multilingual link which leads to the documents content in the web.

law_status¶

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from¶

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

type¶

unicode – This is a sqlalchemy related attribute to provide database table inheritance.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.DocumentReference(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for the relationship between documents.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which references to another document.

reference_document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which is referenced.

document¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.Document – The dedicated relation to the document (which references) instance from database.

referenced_document¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.Document – The dedicated relation to the document (which is referenced) instance from database.

article_numbers¶

str – A colon of article numbers which clarify the reference. This is a string separated by ‘|’.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.DocumentReferenceDefinition(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for the relationship between documents and the reference definition.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which is related to a reference definition.

reference_definition_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which is related to a reference definition.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.Geometry(**kwargs)[source]¶

The dedicated model for all geometries in relation to their public law restriction.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

law_status¶

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from¶

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

geo_metadata¶

str – A link to the metadata which this geometry is based on which delivers machine readable response format (XML).

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction this geometry is related to.

public_law_restriction (pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites

.PublicLawRestriction): The dedicated relation to the public law restriction instance from database.

office_id¶

int – The foreign key to the office which is responsible to this public law restriction.

responsible_office¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

geom¶

geoalchemy2.types.Geometry – The geometry it’s self. For type information see geoalchemy2_. .. _geoalchemy2: https://geoalchemy-2.readthedocs.io/en/0.2.4/types.html docs dependent on the configured type. This concrete one is POLYGON

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.LegalProvision(**kwargs)[source]¶

A subclass of the document representing legal provisions. It is a specialized class of document.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.LegendEntry(**kwargs)[source]¶

A class based legend system which is directly related to pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.ViewService.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

symbol¶

str – An image with represents the legend entry. This can be png or svg. It is string but BaseCode64 encoded.

legend_text¶

dict – Multilingual text to describe this legend entry.

type_code¶

str – Type code of the public law restriction which is represented by this legend entry.

type_code_list¶

str – List of all public law restrictions which are described through this legend entry.

topic¶

str – Statement to describe to which public law restriction this legend entry belongs.

sub_theme¶

str – Description for sub topics this legend entry might belonging to.

other_theme¶

str – A link to additional topics. It must be like the following patterns * ch.{canton}.{topic} * fl.{topic} * ch.{bfsnr}.{topic} This with {canton} as the official two letters short version (e.g.’BE’) {topic} as the name of the topic and {bfsnr} as the municipality id of the federal office of statistics.

view_service_id¶

int – The foreign key to the view service this legend entry is related to.

view_service¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.ViewService – The dedicated relation to the view service instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.Office(**kwargs)[source]¶

The bucket to fill in all the offices you need to reference from public law restriction, document, geometry.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

name¶

dict – The multilingual name of the office.

office_at_web¶

str – A web accessible url to a presentation of this office.

uid¶

str – The uid of this office from https

line1¶

str – The first address line for this office.

line2¶

str – The second address line for this office.

street¶

str – The streets name of the offices address.

number¶

str – The number on street.

postal_code¶

int – The ZIP-code.

city¶

str – The name of the city.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.PublicLawRestriction(**kwargs)[source]¶

The container where you can fill in all your public law restrictions to the topic.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

information¶

dict – The multilingual textual representation of the public law restriction.

topic¶

str – Category for this public law restriction (name of the topic).

sub_theme¶

str – Textual explanation to subtype the topic attribute.

other_theme¶

str – A link to additional topics. It must be like the following patterns * ch.{canton}.{topic} * fl.{topic} * ch.{bfsnr}.{topic} This with {canton} as the official two letters short version (e.g.’BE’) {topic} as the name of the topic and {bfsnr} as the municipality id of the federal office of statistics.

type_code¶

str – Type code of the public law restriction machine readable based on the original data model of this public law restriction.

type_code_list¶

str – List of full range of type_codes for this public law restriction in a machine readable format.

law_status¶

str – The status switch if the document is legally approved or not.

published_from¶

datetime.date – The date when the document should be available for publishing on extracts. This directly affects the behaviour of extract generation.

view_service_id¶

int – The foreign key to the view service this public law restriction is related to.

view_service¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.ViewService – The dedicated relation to the view service instance from database.

office_id¶

int – The foreign key to the office which is responsible to this public law restriction.

responsible_office¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.PublicLawRestrictionBase(**kwargs)[source]¶

Meta bucket (join table) for public law restrictions which acts as a base for other public law restrictions.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which bases on another public law restriction.

public_law_restriction_base_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which is the base for the public law restriction.

plr¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which bases on) instance from database.

base¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which is the base) instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.PublicLawRestrictionDocument(**kwargs)[source]¶

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which has relation to a document.

document_id¶

int – The foreign key to the document which has relation to the public law restriction.

plr¶

document¶

Meta bucket (join table) for public law restrictions which acts as a refinement for other public law restrictions.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

public_law_restriction_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which is refined by another public law restriction.

public_law_restriction_refinement_id¶

int – The foreign key to the public law restriction which is the refinement of the public law restriction.

plr¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which refines) instance from database.

base¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.PublicLawRestriction – The dedicated relation to the public law restriction (which is refined) instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.ReferenceDefinition(**kwargs)[source]¶

The meta bucket for definitions which are directly related to a public law restriction in a common way or to the whole canton or a whole municipality. It is used to have a place to store general documents which are related to an extract but not directly on a special public law restriction situation.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

topic¶

str – The topic which this definition might be related to.

canton¶

str – The canton this definition is related to.

municipality¶

int – The municipality this definition is related to.

office_id¶

int – The foreign key constraint which the definition is related to.

responsible_office¶

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.

class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.ViewService(**kwargs)[source]¶

A view service aka WM(T)S which can deliver a cartographic representation via web.

id¶

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

reference_wms¶

str – The actual url which leads to the desired cartographic representation.

legend_at_web¶

str – A link leading to a wms describing document (png).

Class Article¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.Article(**kwargs)[source]

A subclass of the document representing articles. Article in the sense of a law document. It is often described as a special part of the whole law document and reflects a dedicated content of this.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

number

str – The number which identifies this article in its parent document.

text

dict – A simple multilingual string to describe the article or give some related info.

document_id

int – The foreign key to the document this article is taken from.

document_id

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.Document – The dedicated relation to the document instance from database.

Class Availability¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.Availability(**kwargs)[source]

A simple bucket for achieving a switch per municipality. Here you can configure via the imported data if a public law restriction is available or not. You need to fill it with the data you provided in the app schemas municipality table (fosnr).

fosnr

int – The identifier of the municipality in your system (id_bfs = fosnr)

available

bool – The switch field to configure if this plr is available for the municipality or not. This field has direct influence on the applications behaviour. See documentation for more info.

Class DataIntegration¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.DataIntegration(**kwargs)[source]

The bucket to fill in the date when this whole schema was updated. It has a relation to the office to be able to find out who was the delivering instance.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

date

datetime.date – The date when this data set was delivered.

office_id

int – A foreign key which points to the actual office instance.

office

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.Office – The actual office instance which the id points to.

Class Document¶
class pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.Document(**kwargs)[source]

THE DOCUMENT This represents the main document in the whole system. It is specialized in some sub classes.

id

int – The identifier. This is used in the database only and must not be set manually. If you don’t like it - don’t care about.

title

dict – The multilingual title or if existing the short title ot his document.

office_title

dict – The multilingual official title of this document.

abbrevation

dict – The multilingual shortened version of the documents title.

official_number

str – The official number which uniquely identifies this document.

canton

str – The short version of the canton which this document is about. If this is None this is assumed to be a federal document.

municipality

int – The fosnr (=id bfs) of the municipality. If this is None it is assumed the document is related to the whole canton or even the confederation.

file

str – The document itself as a binary representation (PDF). It is string but BaseCode64 encoded.

office_id

int – The foreign key to the office which is in charge for this document.

responsible_office

pyramid_oereb.standard.models.groundwater_protection_sites.Office – The dedicated relation to the office instance from database.
